availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: John Stewart (Bath County, Kentucky, farmer and private, 10th KY Cav USA)

body.p: Bath County, Kentucky, farmer and soldier. Kentucky native. Married to Kitty Ann Rogers Stewart in Bath County on September 4, 1855. Married to Ellin Hedrick Stewart in Bath County on June 16, 1859. Father of Almina Stewart, Jane Stewart, and Martha Stewart. Farmer in Bath County in 1860. Served in the 10th Kentucky Volunteer Cavalry Regiment (U.S.A.) as a private from September 9, 1862, to September 17, 1863.

ab.bibl:
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Bath County, p. 121.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Bath County, Wyoming, p. 115A.

Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Bath County Marriages, Film #000273007, p. 452 of microfilm, (accessed via Ancestry.com).
Report of the Adjutant General of the State of Kentucky, vol. 1, 1861-1866 (Frankfort: Kentucky Yeoman Office, 1866), 254.
